content: Could someone please take a quick look at this? It is simple enough, but there is a small issue where @Yaël Dillies disagrees with the inclusion of certain lemmas.

My 2c. : both arguments look legitimate:

  • one may be reluctant at adding a lemma which is a direct application of a straightforward mechanism, this is clearly not sustainable in the long range.
  • but particular cases are useful, especially in the absence of a documentation that explains how mathlib expects the user to manipulate stuff which is more comprehensive than the top of Mathlib/Data/Set/Defs.
Meanwhile, is it worthy adding lemmas that do the job but tag them with a comment “you might wish to use?” (like for the deprecated tag, but less strict)?
I've just pushed adding comments to those two lemmas as suggested. I'm hoping to move forward now with the two existing approving reviews; this PR is blocking some others for me.
